name: ButtonWidgetHelper$ButtonBuilder
description: The `ButtonWidgetHelper$ButtonBuilder` class is a nested builder within `ButtonWidgetHelper` that provides a fluent API for creating standard button widgets.
overview:
This builder implements the builder pattern, allowing you to construct button widgets with all their properties set through a chainable, readable API.

The builder is specifically designed for creating standard (non-textured) buttons with customizable text, positioning, styling, and behavior. It's typically obtained through the `new ButtonBuilder(screen)` constructor and provides methods for configuring all button properties before creating the final widget.

constructors.description: The builder constructor takes a screen context where the button will be added.

parameters.name: screen
parameters.description: The screen context for the button

methods.name: x
methods.description: Sets the x-position of the button.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x-coordinate relative to the screen

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .x(50); // Position at x=50

methods.name: y
methods.description: Sets the y-position of the button.

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y-coordinate relative to the screen

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .y(30); // Position at y=30

methods.name: pos
methods.description: Sets both x and y positions simultaneously.

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: The x-coordinate relative to the screen

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: The y-coordinate relative to the screen

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .pos(100, 50); // Position at (100, 50)

methods.name: width
methods.description: Sets the width of the button. Note that button height is always 20 pixels.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the button in pixels

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .width(120); // 120 pixels wide

methods.name: size
methods.description: Alternative method for setting the width.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the button in pixels

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .size(100); // 100 pixels wide

methods.name: message
methods.description: Sets the button text using a TextHelper object.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The button text as a TextHelper object

methods.name: message
methods.description: Sets the button text using a plain string.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The button text as a string

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .message("Button Label");

methods.name: label
methods.description: Alternative method for setting button text.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: The button text as a TextHelper object

methods.name: label
methods.description: Alternative method for setting button text.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: The button text as a string

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .label("Submit");

methods.name: active
methods.description: Sets whether the button is active and can be clicked.

parameters.name: active
parameters.description: Whether the button should be active (clickable)

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .active(true); // Button is clickable

methods.name: visible
methods.description: Sets whether the button should be visible on the screen.

parameters.name: visible
parameters.description: Whether the button should be visible

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .visible(true); // Button is visible

methods.name: alpha
methods.description: Sets the opacity of the button.

parameters.name: alpha
parameters.description: The opacity of the button (0.0-1.0)

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .alpha(0.8); // 80% opacity

methods.name: zIndex
methods.description: Sets the z-index to control rendering order.

parameters.name: zIndex
parameters.description: The z-index for rendering order

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .zIndex(5); // Render above elements with lower z-index

methods.name: setTooltip
methods.description: Sets the tooltip text using a TextHelper object.

parameters.name: tooltip
parameters.description: The tooltip text as a TextHelper object

methods.name: setTooltip
methods.description: Sets the tooltip text using a plain string.

parameters.name: tooltip
parameters.description: The tooltip text as a string

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .setTooltip("Click me for help");

methods.name: setTooltip
methods.description: Sets multiple tooltip lines.

parameters.name: tooltips
parameters.description: Multiple tooltip lines

methods.name: addTooltip
methods.description: Adds an additional tooltip line.

parameters.name: tooltip
parameters.description: Additional tooltip line to append

methods.name: setTooltip
methods.description: Sets multiple tooltip lines from strings.

parameters.name: tooltips
parameters.description: Multiple tooltip strings

examples:
const builder = new ButtonBuilder(screen)
    .setTooltip("Line 1", "Line 2", "Line 3");

methods.name: action
methods.description: Sets the click action handler for the button.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to execute when clicked

methods.name: onClick
methods.description: Alternative method for setting the click action.

parameters.name: onClick
parameters.description: The action to execute when clicked

methods.name: createWidget
methods.description: Creates the button widget with the configured properties and returns it.

methods.name: build
methods.description: Alternative method to create the button widget.
